1 /*********************************************************************
2  * Demo.cpp
3  *
4  * This file shows the basics of setting up a mex file to work with
5  * Matlab. This example shows how to use 2D matricies. This may
6  *
7  * Keep in mind:
8  * <> Use 0-based indexing as always in C or C++
9  * <> Indexing is column-based as in Matlab (not row-based as in C)
10  * <> Use linear indexing. [x*dimy+y] instead of [x][y]
11  *
12  * For more information, see my site: www.shawnlankton.com
13  * by: Shawn Lankton
14  *
15  ********************************************************************/
16 #include <matrix.h>
17 #include <mex.h>
18 #include <gcop/utils.h>
19 #include <gcop/so3.h>
20 #include <gcop/kalmanpredictor.h>
21 #include <gcop/kalmancorrector.h>
22 #include <gcop/unscentedpredictor.h>
23 #include <gcop/unscentedcorrector.h>
24 #include <gcop/point3d.h>

28 /* Definitions to keep compatibility with earlier versions of ML */
29 #ifndef MWSIZE_MAX
30 typedef int mwSize;
31 typedef int mwIndex;
32 typedef int mwSignedIndex;
33 
34 #if (defined(_LP64) || defined(_WIN64)) && !defined(MX_COMPAT_32)
35 /* Currently 2^48 based on hardware limitations */
36 # define MWSIZE_MAX 281474976710655UL
37 # define MWINDEX_MAX 281474976710655UL
38 # define MWSINDEX_MAX 281474976710655L
39 # define MWSINDEX_MIN -281474976710655L
40 #else
41 # define MWSIZE_MAX 2147483647UL
42 # define MWINDEX_MAX 2147483647UL
43 # define MWSINDEX_MAX 2147483647L
44 # define MWSINDEX_MIN -2147483647L
45 #endif
46 #define MWSIZE_MIN 0UL
47 #define MWINDEX_MIN 0UL
48 #endif

50 typedef KalmanPredictor<Point3dState, 6, 3, Dynamic> Point3dKalmanPredictor;
51 typedef KalmanCorrector<Point3dState, 6, 3, Dynamic, Vector3d, 3> Point3dKalmanCorrector;
52 
53 void mexFunction(int nlhs, mxArray *plhs[], int nrhs, const mxArray *prhs[])
54 {
55 
56  //declare variables
57  mxArray *a_in_m, *b_in_m, *c_out_m, *d_out_m;
58  const mwSize *dims;
59  double *a, *b, *c, *d;
60  int dimx, dimy, numdims;
61  int i,j;
62 
63  //associate inputs
64  a_in_m = mxDuplicateArray(prhs[0]);
65  b_in_m = mxDuplicateArray(prhs[1]);
66 
67  //figure out dimensions
68  dims = mxGetDimensions(prhs[0]);
69  numdims = mxGetNumberOfDimensions(prhs[0]);
70  dimy = (int)dims[0]; dimx = (int)dims[1];
71 
72  //associate outputs
73  c_out_m = plhs[0] = mxCreateDoubleMatrix(dimy,dimx,mxREAL);
74  d_out_m = plhs[1] = mxCreateDoubleMatrix(dimy,dimx,mxREAL);
75 
76  //associate pointers
77  a = mxGetPr(a_in_m);
78  b = mxGetPr(b_in_m);
79  c = mxGetPr(c_out_m);
80  d = mxGetPr(d_out_m);
81 
82  //do something
83  for(i=0;i<dimx;i++)
84  {
85  for(j=0;j<dimy;j++)
86  {
87  mexPrintf("element[%d][%d] = %f\n",j,i,a[i*dimy+j]);
88  c[i*dimy+j] = a[i*dimy+j]+5; //adds 5 to every element in a
89  d[i*dimy+j] = b[i*dimy+j]*b[i*dimy+j]; //squares b
90  }
91  }
92 
93  return;
94 }
